alert.note: Alert for Pottawatomie (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 04 at 6:45PM CDT until October 04 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central, east central, and southeast Oklahoma, including the following counties, in central Oklahoma, Cleveland, McClain and Pottawatomie. In east central Oklahoma, Pontotoc and Seminole. In southeast Oklahoma, Hughes. * WHEN...Until 945 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 645 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Southeastern Oklahoma City, eastern Norman, Shawnee, Seminole, Tecumseh, Holdenville, Wewoka, Pink, Konawa, Wetumka, Maud, Earlsboro, Bowlegs, Asher, Tribbey, Wanette, Cromwell, Byars, St. Louis and Lamar. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
